words.definition: An attorney is one who gives others advice about the law.
words.example: The attorney appeared in front of the judge for me.

words.definition: When something is chronic, it happens over and over again over time.
words.example: He had chronic pain in his chest and needed to see a doctor.

words.definition: Discipline is training that helps people follow the rules.
words.example: One of the teacherâ€™s jobs is to teach her students discipline.

words.definition: A donor is somebody who gives something to an organization.
words.example: He was proud to be a blood donor.

words.definition: A fellow is a person who has something in common with you.
words.example: All of my fellow students worked hard on the project.

words.definition: Gossip is information that might be untrue but is still talked about.
words.example: The coworkers spent their lunch break sharing office gossip.

words.definition: To graduate means to complete a course of study at a school or university.
words.example: After he graduated from high school, he went to college.

words.definition: Graffiti is drawings or writing on a wall in a public place.
words.example: The side of the building was covered in colorful graffiti.

words.definition: A guardian is someone who is legally responsible for another person.
words.example: Since both of his parents died, his aunt became his guardian.

words.definition: To implicate someone is to show that they are involved in a crime.
words.example: The evidence implicated the man in the robbery.

words.definition: Kin is a person's family and relatives.
words.example: He invited all of his kin to the family reunion.

words.definition: A referee is a person who makes sure that players follow the rules in a sport.
words.example: The referee blew his whistle to stop the game.

words.definition: To sever something means to cut it off or separate it completely.
words.example: He severed the rope with a sharp knife.

words.definition: A shaft is a long, narrow handle or part of a tool or weapon.
words.example: The arrow had a wooden shaft and a metal tip.

words.definition: To stab means to push a sharp object into something or someone.
words.example: He stabbed the meat with a fork.

words.definition: A stimulus is something that causes growth or activity.
words.example: The tax cut was intended to be a stimulus for the economy.

words.definition: Suspicion is a feeling that someone has done something wrong or illegal.
words.example: The police had a suspicion that the man was lying.

words.definition: To terminate something means to end it.
words.example: The contract was terminated after three years.

words.definition: A theme is the main subject of a book, movie, or talk.
words.example: The theme of the story was that honesty is always the best policy.

words.definition: Tuition is the money paid to a school for instruction.
words.example: College tuition has increased significantly over the years.
